result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffery P. Hoppe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

3:21 p.m.
Clerk Micki. 
INCLUDES 22CF419, 22CF713, and 22CF1024.

State appears by ADA Sidney Brubacher; Defendant appears in person in custody from the MCJ, with Attorney Anne Renc.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed. 
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

State moves to: 
22CF713
COUNT 1: Bail Jumping - Felony >> DRI.
COUNT 2: Resisting or Obstructing an Officer >> DRI.
22CF1024
COUNT 1: Bail Jumping - Felony >> DRI.
COUNT 2: Bail Jumping - Felony >> DRI.

COURT GRANTS.

PLEA to: 
22CF419
COUNT 1: OWI (5th) >> NO CONTEST. 

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS: 4.5 years WPS (1.5 years IC; 3 years ES), with credit for 49 days credit. Conditions of ES: $600.00 fine plus court costs; Any vehicle titled or registered in the Defendant's name is subject to IID installation for 3 years; 1/2 price cost of IID; 3 years DL revocation with any administrative credit; Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent; AODA and f/u; 6pts; Absolute sobriety from alcohol; No driving w/o a valid driver's license; and DNA sample and surcharge. Eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

ADJ: 3:40 p.m.
